0.text: Bug 43599  [KeyBindings] accelerators on Mac OS X 'application menu' should not always be active.

1.text: Command+Q closes eclipse on Mac OS X due to this accelerator being registered on the mac- specific 'application menu'.

2.text: This means you can close eclipse within a dialog, which causes unpredictable results (usually  errors in the log regarding disposing of widgets..)  Command+Q, perhaps all all accelerators in this menu, should be disabled when in dialogs.

3.text: A  more complete solution would provide us explicit control over these accelerators for rebinding.

4.text: I remember Andre saying that he had a solution for this, and I know that the MRJ toolkit from  apple has some (AWT dependant) API for managing this menu.
